oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1953-04-25 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from April 25, 1953. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), George Morgan (host/performer), guest performer Hank Thompson and his Brazos Valley Boys, and regular performers Minnie Pearl, Tommy Jackson, Lew Childre, the Old Hickory Singers, Rod Brasfield, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that the Carter Sisters will be the guest the following week.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Old Hickory Singers; Rod Brasfield; Hank Thompson; Brazos Valley Boys; Stringbean; George Morgan
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Floating Down The River (Old Hickory Singers) -- George Morgan introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, George Morgan) -- George Morgan introduces Hank Thompson -- Rub-A-Dub-Dub (Hank Thompson and his Brazos Valley Boys) -- George Morgan introduces Stringbean -- John Henry (Stringbean) -- George Morgan talks -- I'll Go On Alone (George Morgan) -- Closing theme -- Closing statement (George Morgan) -- Cavalier Cigarettes commercial -- Network announcements
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); Ryman Auditorium (Nashville, Tenn.); Turner, Grant; Morgan, George, 1925-1975; Martin, Grady, 1929-; Sharpe, Claude, 1902-1969; Old Hickory Singers; Minnie Pearl; Brasfield, Rod; Stringbean, 1915-1973; Thompson, Hank; Brazos Valley Boys; Jackson, Tommy; Childre, Lew, 1901-1961
